body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Natural Features & Ecosystems               Natural Features & Ecosystems         The interface between the sunlit and nether worlds   Mammoth Cave, by far the world's longest known cave system, is the heart of the South-Central Kentucky karst, an integrated set of subterranean drainage basins covering more than 1,050 square kilometers â€“ 400 square miles.  Atop this labyrinth is a biologically diverse set of ecosystems inextricably interlinked with the ecosystems underground.  This physiographic province, with Mammoth Cave National Park at its core, was declared an International Biosphere Reserve in 1990.
title: Mammoth Cave National Park: Natural Features & Ecosystems
